meanings.definition: To make a clamor or loud noise.
meanings.sent1: The children beclamored for attention during the school play.
meanings.sent2: The thunderstorm beclamored outside, shaking the windows.
meanings.sent3: The beclamoring of the birds in the morning woke me up with a start.
meanings.sent4: The protesters beclamored for justice in the streets, their voices echoing through the city.
meanings.sent5: The beclamors of the busy marketplace filled the air with a chaotic symphony.

meanings.definition: To shout or cry out loudly.
meanings.sent1: She beclamors for help when she sees a spider in the room.
meanings.sent2: The coach beclamored instructions to the players from the sidelines.
meanings.sent3: The toddler beclamored for ice cream, her voice piercing the peaceful afternoon.
meanings.sent4: The singer beclamored the lyrics of the song, captivating the audience with her powerful voice.
meanings.sent5: The fans beclamored the name of their favorite player, creating a deafening roar in the stadium.

meanings.definition: To demand or call for something loudly.
meanings.sent1: The workers beclamored for fair wages and better working conditions.
meanings.sent2: The crowd beclamored for the band to play an encore.
meanings.sent3: The cat beclamored for attention by knocking things off the table.
meanings.sent4: The politician beclamored for change during the rally, promising a better future for all.
meanings.sent5: The students beclamored for a longer recess, their voices blending into a unified plea.
